title: Trump Attacks Allies Demanding Epstein Files as ‘Stupid People’ - Bloomberg
description: President Donald Trump lashed out at fellow Republicans who have been calling for his administration to release documents related to disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, casting the files as a distraction spun up by Democrats to undermine his agenda.

title: Dutch-Style Road Intersections Offer a Safer Way Forward for Bikes, Walkers - Bloomberg
description: Inspired by road safety innovations widely used in the Netherlands, several US cities are installing street crossings that can better protect pedestrians and bicyclists.

title: India Seeks Lower Tariff Than Indonesia in Race to Clinch Deal - Bloomberg
description: Indian officials are hoping to secure a trade deal with US President Donald Trump at a lower tariff rate than he’d agreed with Indonesia as New Delhi races to meet an Aug. 1 deadline.

title: US Trade Schools, Like Texas’s TSTC, See Rising Enrollment - Bloomberg
description: There are already more than 400,000 open manufacturing industry jobs in the US, and that’s before the domestic factory boom Trump’s been promising.

title: Trump Memecoin Unlock to Test Crypto Demand, Boost President’s Wealth - Bloomberg
description: A batch of Trump memecoins set to be unlocked this week will test demand for the cryptocurrency and add almost $100 million to the billionaire president’s net worth.

title: Stock Market Today: Dow, S&P Live Updates for July 16 - Bloomberg
description: Speculation about the fate of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell set off a short-lived tempest in financial markets Wednesday, with volatility mostly quelled after President Donald Trump said he has no plans to fire the central bank chief and was only discussing it in “concept.”

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX Share Sale to Value Company at About $400 Billion - Bloomberg
description: Elon Musk’s SpaceX is planning an insider share sale that would value the company at about $400 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Asia's 50 Best Bars 2025: Bar Leone in Hong Kong Is Named No. 1 Again - Bloomberg
description: Hong Kong’s Bar Leone, once again, has been crowned Asia’s best bar.

title: The Most Worrying Economic Chart in the World - Bloomberg
description: Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.

title: Diplomatic Experience Is Optional for the President’s Friends - Bloomberg
description: Trump went for loyalty with ambassadorial nominations in Southeast Asia.

title: Watch The End of the Long Bond Era - Bloomberg
description:
From the US to Japan, governments are having to pay investors more to get them to lend money by buying bonds. Now countries everywhere are pulling back on issuing longer-term debt.
 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Why Art Deco Jewelry From the 1920s Still Sells for Millions - Bloomberg
description: It’s been a century since the exposition in Paris gave birth to a movement. Its appeal has never faded.

title: US Immigration Crackdown Raises Concerns Over Child ‘Wellness Checks’ - Bloomberg
description: The Trump administration’s $45 billion for detention is raising fresh concerns over law enforcement visits to families.

title: Wall Street’s Blackstone Is Buying Marinas: Bigger Yachts, Higher Rent - Bloomberg
description: Blackstone and others pledge to improve aging boatyards amid fears that rising slip fees are pricing out the middle class.

title: Watch The Lawyer Behind Elon Musk, Jay-Z and Megan Thee Stallion - Bloomberg
description: Emily Chang meets power lawyer Alex Spiro to discuss how he navigates the high-stakes world of litigation on behalf of famous clients.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Never Fully Beaten, Inflation Is Coming Back to Life - Bloomberg
description: Just in time for a rates showdown between Trump and the Federal Reserve.

title: Aura Minerals Shares Mixed in US Trading Debut (AUGO, ORA CN) - Bloomberg
description: Aura Minerals Inc. shares were little changed from the offer price in a US trading debut, after the gold and copper miner raised $196 million in a listing in New York.

title: Severe Obesity in US Children Has More Than Tripled Since 2008 - Bloomberg
description: The proportion of severely overweight children in the US has skyrocketed in recent years, with the highest rates seen in adolescents and Black children, a new study found.

title: SBI Seeks $2.9 Billion in Biggest Share Sale to Institutions - Bloomberg
description: State Bank of India is seeking to raise as much as 250 billion rupees ($2.9 billion) in India’s biggest share sale to institutional investors as the country’s top lender by assets seeks to bolster its capital base, according to terms of the deal seen by Bloomberg News.

title: Kganyago Sees South Africa CPI Staying in Target Despite Risks - Bloomberg
description: South Africa’s central bank Governor Lesetja Kganyago signaled confidence that inflation would remain within its target for the next two years, despite uncertainties stemming from US tariffs.

title: New York's Coqodaq Has 1,000 Person-a-Night Waitlist for Sustainable Chicken - Bloomberg
description: One of New York’s hottest food venues is luring diners with viral caviar-topped nuggets, and delivering a message on environmentally-friendly eating.

title: Dutch Government Ditches ‘Not Realistic’ Offshore Wind Goal - Bloomberg
description: The Netherlands will slash its offshore wind ambitions by as much as 40% as the government no longer finds it viable to aim for 50 gigawatts of generation capacity by 2040.

title: India and Asean Are Growing Apart. Blame Tariffs - Bloomberg
description: Officials in New Delhi worry the bloc is drifting toward China.

title: Trump Tariffs: Norway, US Have a ‘Good Tone’ in Trade Talks, Stoltenberg Says - Bloomberg
description: Norway is addressing “some real issues” in its trade talks with the US and still aims to prevent increases in tariffs, according to the country’s finance minister.

title: Bloomberg Surveillance: Tariffs Inflation - Bloomberg
description: The economy and the markets are "under surveillance" as we cover the latest in finance, economics and investment.

title: Zambian Small Businesses Get $70 Million Boost to Aid Growth - Bloomberg
description: Britain and Sweden’s development-finance arms are partnering with the Zambian National Pension Scheme Authority to launch an investment platform backed by an initial $70 million to provide capital for the southern African nation’s small and medium-sized businesses.

title: KKR Mulls Acquisition of Health-Care Technology Firm GPI (GPI IM) - Bloomberg
description: KKR & Co., the buyout firm that’s been scouting for takeover targets amid the recent market volatility, is considering a potential acquisition of Italian health-care technology firm GPI SpA, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Compass' Private Home Listings Roil Zillow, Rival Real Estate Brokerages - Bloomberg
description: No. 1 brokerage Compass is pushing for sellers to market houses exclusively. Rivals and digital giant Zillow are striking back.

title: Tetra Pak’s Secretive Rausing Family Builds $9 Billion in Global Stock Bets - Bloomberg
description: A mysterious entity based in the heart of Singapore’s financial district emerged as the biggest shareholder in International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. nine years ago.

title: For Hot Independent Jewelry Designers, Art Deco Is the Secret Sauce - Bloomberg
description: For a certain category of elite jewelers, returning to the century-old style of art deco has been a proven moneymaker.

title: SpaceX Plans Starship Program for In-Orbit Drug Research - Bloomberg
description: SpaceX is working on a program to use its mammoth Starship rocket to develop commercial products in space, potentially opening up a new business line for the world’s most valuable private startup, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Forget DOGE. Elon Musk Is Suddenly All In on AI - Bloomberg
description: On this episode of Elon, Inc. , we discuss the new model of his notorious Grok chatbot and reminisce about the Trump administration salad days.

title: Nigeria Inflation Eases Again, Bolstering Case to Hold Rates - Bloomberg
description: Nigeria’s annual inflation rate fell for a third straight month in June, bolstering the case for policymakers to again keep borrowing costs unchanged as they wait to see if the trend holds.

title: How North Korea Is Giving Russia an Edge in the War on Ukraine - Bloomberg
description: Without the involvement of North Korea, Russia’s war in Ukraine might have taken a different turn. The infusion of weaponry and troops provided by Kim Jong Un’s regime has helped Russia to repel Ukrainian forces from its soil and keep up the relentless bombardment of Ukrainian towns and cities. North Korea has likely received military aid in return, increasing the threat posed by the isolated nation to the US and its allies in East Asia.

title: JPMorgan (JPM) Is Now Worth More Than Three Largest Rivals Combined - Bloomberg
description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. keeps putting more distance between itself and key rivals.

title: The Electric Vehicle Revolution Will Be Bifurcated - Bloomberg
description: Thanks for reading Hyperdrive, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the future of the auto world.

title: Oil-Rich University of Texas Wants to Cash in on AI, Solar, Wind, Crypto - Bloomberg
description: The system—with an endowment second only to Harvard’s—is diversifying into wind and solar energy at a fraught time for renewables.

title: Japan’s Super-Long Bonds Rebound Amid Pre-Election Volatility - Bloomberg
description: Japan’s super-long bonds rose on Wednesday, reversing course after a rout earlier in the week over concern that an election this weekend will result in higher government spending.

title: ‘Shark Tank’ Companies Are Feeling the Bite of Trump’s Tariffs - Bloomberg
description: Despite the wild swings in trade policies, these entrepreneurs say the math on reshoring doesn’t work for them.

title: Watch The Gambler's Edge on Wall Street - Bloomberg
description: Poker. Blackjack. Chess. What role does traditional game theory play in the markets? And how are successful traders using it? (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tesla Readies a Six-Seat Version of the Model Y SUV for China - Bloomberg
description: Tesla Inc. is preparing to launch a longer, six-seat version of its Model Y sport utility vehicle in China, where the carmaker has been losing ground to domestic manufacturers with fresher lineups.

title: New World Seeks to Sell 11 Skies Airport Mall in Hong Kong - Bloomberg
description: New World Development Co. is seeking to sell its flagship 11 Skies airport mall in Hong Kong to address liquidity constraints, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Nextdoor Makes a Bet on Local News in Unlikely Partnership - Bloomberg

description: In a residential loft building in Chelsea, one of New York City’s original 19th-century horse elevators managed to survive into modernity - until now. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Lawyers Warn UK NDA Ban May Reduce Misconduct Settlement Payouts - Bloomberg
description: A landmark ban on the use of non-disclosure agreements in workplace misconduct cases - a longstanding practice of financial firms - may make it harder for victims to win compensation and discourage some from speaking up, lawyers say.

description: Analyzing trends in leadership, company culture and the art of career building.

title: Why UK Inflation Is So High and What It Means for Interest Rates - Bloomberg
description: While a post-pandemic burst of inflation has abated across much of the developed world, Britain is still stuck with the highest price growth among big western economies.

title: Press contacts | Bloomberg LP
Saudi Arabia Faces a Decision on Cutting Oil Output After Exceeding OPEC+ Target - Bloomberg
description: The kingdom pumped 385,000 barrels a day above its OPEC+ quota, citing Middle East tensions.

title: Spain Blackout Investigation Shows EU Grids Need More Resilience - Bloomberg

description: The UK’s previous government set up a secret immigration route for Afghans affected by a data breach three years ago and then kept it secret from the British public, Defence Secretary John Healey said.

description: Brian Niccol’s turnaround strategy, complete with cold and protein-infused foams, is starting to yield results. How long will it take—and how much will it cost?

description: President Donald Trump is frustrated that the Federal Reserve hasn’t lowered interest rates this year. At the biggest US banks, loan yields are steadily dropping anyway.

title: Trump’s Cuts to Federal Government Are Making Data Disappear - Bloomberg
description: Online tools that professionals use for everything from diagnosing diseases to calculating insurance payouts are going dark.

description: Tesla Inc. opened its first India showroom, showcasing Model Y cars with a starting price of nearly $70,000, as Elon Musk’s electric-vehicle maker looks to tap new markets and offset slowing sales where it’s already well established.

title: Hedge Funds in Ukraine Are Drawing a Line in State Rail Bond Restructuring - Bloomberg
description: Credit investors have largely supported debt restructurings in Ukraine since Russia’s invasion. But some holders of Ukrainian Railways’ bonds are reluctant to engage in new debt talks until the government allows it to raise freight charges.

title: Newsletters - Bloomberg
description: Get newsletters like the Morning and Evening Briefings, Markets Daily, Matt Levine's Money Stuff and more when you subscribe today.

description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google will debut new Pixel-branded hardware at an event on Aug. 20 in New York, with the lineup expected to include several smartphones and a smartwatch, all powered by the company’s artificial intelligence technology.

description: It could have been a marketing mess.

title: Ex-NYPD Commissioner Sues Mayor Eric Adams Over 'Systemic Corruption' - Bloomberg

title: Why Thames Water Faces Nationalization Threat as Losses, Growing Debt Bite - Bloomberg
description: Britain’s water industry is bracing for the biggest overhaul since privatization in 1989 amid a scandal over systematic sewage spills and chronic pipe leaks. Customers are set to shoulder the cost of fixing the problems through the largest ever bill increases for households and businesses.

title: France Adds Support for Using Most-Potent Trade Tool on US - Bloomberg
description: A growing number of European Union member states want the bloc to activate its most powerful trade tool against the US should the two sides fail to reach an acceptable agreement by Aug. 1 and Donald Trump carries out his threat of 30% tariffs on the US’s largest trading partner.

title: Australia Eyes Cash Distribution Reform as Online Payments Boom - Bloomberg
description: Australian regulators will look into a potential framework for the distribution of physical money across the country as increasing use of online and card payments add to complexities of keeping cash in circulation.

title: Trump Targets NASA Space Junk Tracking Service That He Started - Bloomberg
description: Hello, this is Melos Ambaye in New York. During his first term, President Donald Trump started a space traffic safety program to keep track of objects in orbit, including space junk. Now, at a time when the risks from collisions with space debris are growing, he’s trying to cut it. But first ...

title: Trump Says He’ll Send Tariff Letters to More Than 150 Countries - Bloomberg
description: President Donald Trump said he would send letters to more than 150 countries notifying them of tariff rates as he pushes ahead with a trade agenda that has sent US partners racing to avoid higher import taxes.

description: With less than four months to go until the COP30 climate summit in the Amazon city of Belém, Brazil’s government is trying to reassure those planning to attend that there’ll be enough places to sleep.

description: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly sit for a special conversation with two titans, football coach Bill Belichick and Bridgewater founder Ray Dalio, to learn their guiding principles for success. (Source: Bloomberg)

description: President Donald Trump has dialed down his confrontational tone with China in an effort to secure a summit with counterpart Xi Jinping and a trade deal with the world’s second-largest economy, people familiar with internal deliberations said.

description: Froneri International Ltd., the maker of Häagen-Dazs ice cream, is wrapping up commitments for a debt deal to help fund one of the largest shareholder payouts on record, as its private equity co-owner looks to keep its stake in the company for longer.

description: Understand every aspect of the global economy – and know how to make your next move.

title: Trump Tower Belgrade Sparks Serbia Backlash, Corruption Probe: Kushner Deal - Bloomberg
description: A luxe hotel and apartments would go on the site of a defense ministry bombed by US-led NATO forces in 1999. A former government official was accused of forging paperwork to clear the way for the project.

description: President Donald Trump is fighting to end automatic citizenship for children born to parents who are in the country unlawfully or on temporary visas, part of his broader crackdown on undocumented immigrants and a change that could overturn more than a century of legal precedent.

title: PNC Considers Charging Fintechs for Access to Customer Data - Bloomberg
description: PNC Financial Services Group Inc. is considering charging financial-technology companies for access to valuable customer data, following the lead of JPMorgan Chase & Co., Chief Executive Officer Bill Demchak said.
